metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20024 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before commit 4a21bbd097ef7c44bb000c3bd0907f96a10e4ce7 contains null pointer dereference in VNC client code that can result DoS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1.2
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1.2
No subscription required

ssvnc - 1.0.29-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1.2').
ssvnc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.29-5').
